column4: blairellisL im sure with the advanced options you can be more specific.. but it might just use the ENTIRE free space
again my experience is from customers (people needed wireless lan's setup, people that pay me to do it, IE: average people)
sure, but some areas are prone to WEP attacks. If the client has WPA compatible hardware, it is the obvious choice. I live in an affluent part of the UK, and I've seen people hijack my WEP network
